intro: Psychotria reflexipes, commonly known as the reflexed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Psychotria reflexipes is also noted for its aromatic leaves, which have been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
